James Fennell (1766–1816), educated at Eton and Trinity College, Cambridge, took up acting when he had mortgaged his inheritance at the age of 21 to pay his gambling debts. As an actor he was known especially for his Othello, with successes in both Edinburgh and London. He emigrated to America in
